column4: The ubuntu 7.04 (feisty) archive seems to have disappeared.  Where can I find it.
There's a difference between "not supporting" and "sabotaging".  I need some 7.04 packages.
Anyone know where I can find a 7.04 repo?
I was actually hoping the official archive.ubuntu.com would keep them =\

no, they wouldnt keep them, its like microsoft not selling obsolete software anymore, ubuntu wont keep obsolete software either, you can check a torrent or mirror site if you want an older version that is no longer supported

That's a crappy policy.  So Ubuntu basically forces people upgrade their computers.  This takes time and costs money, and is unnecessary if the server runs fine.  Who's going to pay for this?  Ubuntu?
hippie if you want ubuntu 7.04 you can download it off a mirror or torrent
ok so what is the problem?
I'm just trying to get my point though to you =)
as far as I understand, you asked a question, you got the resolution you required, and you are trying to banter because of principle?
there are no latest patches/upgrades for that OS, it is dead.
not in the repos or synaptic, you would have to compile it yourself
I'm not talking about the software developers latest version -- I'm talking about the latest version Ubuntu released.
